note.p: Research Field: Kinematics of mechanisms, testing of materials and machines

Career: Involved in the development of electric lighting, of trams, and of railways; designed electrical works in India and Japan; Consulting Engineer to LNWR, LSWR, and to LCC tramways; Professor of Engineering, University College, London; Chairman, Admiralty Committee on Machinery Designs (World War 1); Chairman, Admiralty Committee on Gun-sights and Range Finders (World War 1); explored the city of Petra (1922?)
Obituaries: Obituary Notices of Fellows of the Royal Society 1936-1938 vol 2 pp 213-223, plate, by Alexander Gibb
References: F C Moon, 'Robert Willis and Franz Reuleaux: pioneers in the theory of machines' in NR 2003 vol 57 pp 209-230
